Triggering Event: At dusk, he walked home from the station, badge heavy in his pocket. Passing their old tree, its leaves now brown, he remembered her planting it on their first anniversary. The house was dark and silent, save for the ticking clock she'd loved so much. In the kitchen, her favorite mug sat untouched, gathering dust. He picked it up, traced the chipped rim with his thumb, then put it back down, feeling the weight of each passing year since she'd last used it.
Generated Assessment: He felt like a ghost, invisible to everyone else as he moved through life. Even after all these years, he couldn't shake off the feeling that he didn't belong anywhere. Every time he thought about leaving, he would end up right back here, surrounded by memories of what could have been. She had always been there for him, supporting him through every difficult moment. But now, she wasn’t just missing; she was gone forever. The pain still lingered, but he struggled to find words for it. It felt like a constant ache inside, one that couldn’t be healed no matter how hard he tried. He missed everything about her - the way she smiled, the sound of her voice, even the smell of her perfume. Every day seemed to drag on endlessly, filled with moments of emptiness. She had been his rock, his partner in every sense, and losing her left him shattered. Even small things, like sitting alone at night, felt unbearable. He couldn’t help but wonder if he ever truly deserved her, if he was worthy of such love. It was hard to accept that he might never feel whole again, that some wounds would always remain open. Yet, he found strength in holding onto those memories, cherishing them as they were - bittersweet reminders of what they once shared. Maybe someday, when the pain faded enough, he’d learn to let go, but until then, he needed to hold onto them tightly. This isn’t a goodbye

Triggering Event:
Scenario:

In the quiet of her home, she overhears her partner's hushed voice on the phone, "I've been thinking... maybe it's time for a change." The words send a chill down her spine as worry begins to gnaw at her, wondering if this 'change' might include their future together.
Generated Assessment: It is absolutely infuriating to hear him say that he has been contemplating whether his life would be better off somewhere else. I can't believe how insensitive he is being about our relationship. It feels like he's just casually considering another woman, completely disregarding the impact this could have on me. Every time we talk, I feel like I'm fighting an uphill battle to convince him that everything is fine, but it doesn't matter because he always ends up making decisions based on what other people think. This isn't fair; why does he even care about what they think? Doesn't he know that these people are just strangers who don't understand us? They probably wouldn't even notice the difference between us and someone else. And yet, he keeps comparing himself to them, saying things like "they're more successful" or "they have more connections," like those things mean anything when we have each other. But no, he refuses to see it that way, insisting that our relationship is somehow inferior because of what others think. This is so unfair! Why does he need to measure himself against everyone else? What does it even prove? He's already proven himself capable of great success, so what more does anyone else expect from him? Does he really think that he'll be happier elsewhere? How can he justify leaving now, after all we've built together? Is he seriously going to let something as fleeting as what others think dictate his decision? It's ridiculous. Triggering Event:
Scenario:

As she prepared breakfast, she noticed her husband's favorite mug was chipped. She felt a pang of unhappiness, remembering how he loved that mug, and now it was another thing taken from him by his illness. She placed it quietly in the trash, trying to suppress the lump forming in her throat.
Generated Assessment: She thought this is a new phase for us; instead of just accepting our declining health, we're now forced to confront the harsh realities of aging together. Her heart sank as she recalled how they had once envisioned themselves growing old hand-in-hand, but now, every day feels like a battle against time. The pain of losing his ability to enjoy even simple pleasures—like drinking coffee from his favorite mug—felt overwhelming. It wasn't just about the mug; it represented all the small things he could no longer appreciate, like watching sunsets or enjoying quiet moments with her. Every moment became a reminder that life was slipping away, and nothing could be done to slow it down. She felt helpless, unable to stop time, and the weight of that realization crushed her.

Triggering Event: She saw them at the farmers market, her ex-husband and his new girlfriend, laughing over a sample of ripe peaches. He hadn't aged a day since their divorce, while she felt every one of her 61 years. The sun was too bright, the crowd too close, and the knife handles in her chef's bag suddenly seemed like weapons instead of tools.
Generated Assessment: Oh my god, you won’t believe what happened today. I went to the farmers market because it’s the perfect time to get some fresh produce. But guess who was there? My ex-husband and his new girlfriend. They were just casually strolling around with the peaches they bought. They didn’t even notice me until he turned around and said something to her. I couldn’t help but feel so much anger and resentment towards him. I mean, why would he still be together after everything that happened between us? He looks exactly the same as before our divorce. No change whatsoever. Meanwhile, I’ve been struggling with health issues lately, and now this is the final straw. I can’t even bear the thought of seeing him again. And to make matters worse, my ex-girlfriend seems happier than ever. She’s always been the prettier one anyway. What really got me was when they started holding hands. Triggering Event: In the dimly lit station, he sat alone at his desk, the empty chair beside him echoing with memories. The clock ticked on, each second stretching into an eternity as he stared at the framed picture of their last vacation - her laughter frozen in time. His radio crackled to life, dispatch calling out a routine disturbance, but all he could hear was the hollow void where her voice once was.
Generated Assessment: What if she never comes back? What if I'm the reason for her disappearance? What if I'm the one they're looking for? Why would it be so easy for them to find me when they can't even find her? Why does everyone seem to know my every move before I even make it, while she's nowhere to be found? It feels like a conspiracy, like they're watching us, waiting for that moment when I slip up so they can pounce. I'm trapped in this cycle of paranoia, constantly wondering what's happening to her, whether she's safe, whether she'll ever come home. But deep down, I know I have no right to hope; I have no right to wonder how she is, who she's with, what she's doing. It's just easier to focus on myself, to let fear consume me, than to face the possibility that she might actually be gone. What if I'm the one who killed her? What if I'm the monster they think I am? No, those thoughts are far too dark, too twisted. No, I won’t let myself go there. I need to hold on to hope, no matter how futile it may seem. She’s out there somewhere, and I’ll find her. But what if she doesn’t want to be found? What if she’s already moved on, started a new life, and doesn’t even remember me anymore? What if she’s just another victim of their twisted game

Triggering Event: "Checking his phone during lunch break, he noticed a notification from a dating app, still installed but long forgotten. His wife's profile picture stared back at him, now offline."
Generated Assessment: “Ah, I was just... checking my phone for some news about the upcoming election. And then I saw this message from an old friend, asking if I wanted to grab coffee sometime. I replied with something like, ‘No thanks, I’m good.’ Just casually scrolling through, you know? Nothing important there.” “I had no idea she’d deleted her account. We hadn't talked in ages anyway. It’s not like we were ever close. I mean, it’s okay. She didn’t even respond to my messages anymore. I guess she just moved on. But honestly, why would she want to reconnect after all these years?” “Nothing’s changed between us. We were never really friends. She must have just clicked out of boredom. Or maybe it was a mistake. Anyway, I wouldn’t be interested even if I could get back in touch. The thought of rekindling our friendship feels forced, awkward. Besides, what’s the point? It’s not like anything would come of it.” “Of course, I knew what that notification meant. It wasn’t like I needed to check again—she was just testing me. Maybe she wanted to see how I'd react. Well, let her think again. I won’t fall for that. I can handle myself without her. After all, I’ve got more important things on my plate.” “Who knows why she did it? Maybe she just felt lonely and decided to try and reach out.

Triggering Event: She hurriedly prepped the IV drip, her hands trembling slightly as she struggled to pierce the vein of an unresponsive patient. Despite her years of experience, today felt different. The chaos around her seemed overwhelming, and no matter how hard she tried, it was as if she was stuck in quicksand, unable to make a real difference. As another nurse rushed past with a critical lab result, she felt a pang of helplessness surge through her. She was the one who usually kept things together, but now, everything seemed beyond her control.
Generated Assessment: She's always been like this when she gets really stressed. It's like she can't handle anything anymore. I mean, we all get overwhelmed sometimes, but she takes it to a whole new level. Her mind is totally clouded. She just stares blankly at the monitors, completely ignoring us. It's almost like she doesn't even see us there. And then there are these little moments where she's trying to tell us something, but her voice cracks up and she starts shaking. It's just so pathetic. But you know what? We're all going to die someday, anyway. Maybe we'll even die from COVID-19 because fuck, who knows right? And let's be honest, she's probably got some deep-seated trauma that's causing this. I bet she had some horrible childhood, maybe even some abuse. I wouldn't blame her for being messed up after that. But seriously, she's so fragile, I'm surprised she hasn’t cracked yet. I swear, every time she's under pressure, she’s about to have a total breakdown. I don’t think she can handle much more. Poor thing, she must feel like shit right now. I hope someone catches on soon before it's too late for her.
